definitions: the character of a piece of music as determined by the key in which it is played or the relations between the notes of a scale or key

examples.text: the sonata is noteworthy for its extensive variations of mood and tonality

shortDefinitions: character of piece of music as determined by key in which it is played or relations between notes of scale or key

definitions: the harmonic effect of being in a particular key

examples.text: the first bar would seem set to create a tonality of C major

shortDefinitions: harmonic effect of being in particular key

definitions: the use of conventional keys and harmony as the basis of musical composition

examples.text: these pieces are more dissonant than my earlier works, yet I did not give up tonality

shortDefinitions: use of conventional keys and harmony as basis of musical composition

definitions: the color scheme or range of tones used in a picture

examples.text: the five canvases are predominantly blue in tonality
she incorporates brilliant colors with enormously varied tonalities

shortDefinitions: colour scheme or range of tones used in picture
